intro: Teucrium nipponicum, commonly known as Japanese germander, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple, arranged in whorled clusters at the leaf axils. Teucrium nipponicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
